---
  title: Cherokee
---
#Background
**Language family**: Iroquoian / Southern Iroquian / Cherokee

#Phonology

##Consonants
###Consonants by place
Labial: /m/
Alveolar: /d/, /tʰ/, /ts/, /s/, /n/, /l/
Palatal: /j/
Velar: /g/, /k/, /ɰ/
Glottal: /ʔ/, /h/

###Consonants by manner
Stop: /d/, /tʰ/, /g/, /k/, /ʔ/
Affricate: /ts/
Fricative: /s/, /h/
Nasal: /m/, /n/
Approximant: /l/, /j/, /ɰ/

##Vowels
Front close: /i/, /iː/
Front mid: /e/, /eː/
Central mid: /ə̃/, /ə̃ː/
Central open: /a/, /aː/
Back close: /u/, /uː/
Back mid: /o/, /oː/

#Alphabet
Cherokee has both a syllabary and a Latin script. 
Latin script: 
A, a: /a/
D, d: /d/
E, e: /e/
G, g: /g/
H, h: /h/
I, i: /i/
K, k: /k/
L, l: /l/ or /ɬ/
M, m: /m/ (appears in very few native words)
N, n: /n/
O, o: /o/
Q, q: /kʰw/
S, s: /s/
T, t: /t/
U, u: /u/
V, v: /ə̃/
W, w: /ɰ/
Y, y; /j/

#Rules
/l/ > [ɬ] /t_
C[-voice -sonorant -continuant] > Cʰ/_V
